results.title: Mr. Deeds goes to town
results.brief_description: One of the most successful comedies, this is the story of Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), an unassuming, tuba-playing young country hick who inherits his uncle’s $20 million estate. He is catapulted from small-town peace to New York turmoil. Discovering he’s been duped by crooked big city associates and the beautiful girl reporter (Jean Arthur) whom he loves, Deeds decides to give away his fortune to the needy. His lawyer interprets this as a sign of insanity and a bitter courtroom battle ensues with Deeds refusing to testify. Only love can save the day. This timeless “little-man-against-the-world” comedy-drama won Capra the 1936 Academy Award for Best Director and received five Oscar nominations, including Best Picture and Best Actor.

results.title: Mr Robinson Crusoe
results.creator_credit: Elton Corporation, Douglas Fairbanks and Edward Sutherland
results.brief_description: A rich playboy makes a bet that he can live on a desert island for a year without the luxuries of modern life. A satire of the classic novel by Daniel Defoe filmed on location on a Tahitian Island with Douglas Fairbanks playing an acrobatic Crusoe. Cast also includes William Farnum, Earle Browne and Maria Alba.

results.title: Mr Reliable: a true story
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, PolyGram Filmproduktion, Hayes McElroy Productions, State of Queensland, Jim McElroy, Terry Hayes, Michael Hamlyn and Nadia Tass
results.brief_description: In 1968, petty criminal Wally Melish (Colin Friels), earns himself the reputation of folk hero when he finds himself embroiled in an eight day siege with his girlfriend Beryl (Jacqueline McKenzie), after the police mistakenly think he has taken her hostage. The siege is marked by a marriage (between Wally and Beryl), and the media circus which captures the days events on national television. Based on a real event, cast includes Geoff Merrell, Neil Fitzpatrick, Lisa Hensley, Barry Otto and Paul Sonkkila.

results.title: Mr and Mrs Smith
results.brief_description: A Hitchcock movie with a difference, a romantic comedy. Successful New York couple David and Anne Smith live happily by mutually agreed rules, that is until their secrecy is shattered by a visit from the civil celebrant who married them some years earlier in Anne’s home town. He has arrived to tell them that due to a state boundary dispute at the time of their wedding, they are not legally married. Social conventions of the time require them to take up separate residences immediately as they reconsider whether they really wish to be married or whether their futures lie better apart.

results.title: Moving in = Firstborn
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Jaffe-Lansing Productions, Witt, Thomas Productions, Paul Junger Witt, Tony Thomas, Ron Koslow and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: A story of relationships, love, loyalty and family - and intruders who upset the balance. Wendy (Teri Garr) is a young divorced mother with two sons, Jake (Christopher Collet) and Brian (Corey Haim). Mother and sons appear to cope reasonably well in their relationships towards one another with the usual generational disagreements and ups and downs all families face at one time or another. However, when Sam (Peter Weller) enters into Wendy’s life, the boys find themselves gradually being pushed aside as their mother’s interest in Sam turns increasingly to love. When Sam moves in, both Jake and Brian become suspicious of his motives and eventually it is up to Jake, as first born, to try and take control of a situation that is rapidly getting out of hand. Both boys are determined to protect their mother at all costs but for Jake it is a moment of confrontation and making choices. Contains some violent scenes. Cast also includes a very young Sarah Jessica Parker as Jake’s girlfriend, Lisa and Robert Downey Jr (also in his teens) as one of Jake’s friends, Lee.

results.title: Movie crazy
results.creator_credit: Harold Lloyd Corporation, Harold Lloyd and Clyde Bruckman
results.brief_description: Lloyd’s alter ego is developed further in this film about a starstruck movie lover who, through a misunderstanding, lands the promise of a screen test. His adventures in Hollywood are predictably punctuated by a myriad of clever sight-gags involving various obstacles and near disasters. Although one of his late films, this is considered the best of Lloyd’s ‘talkies’ with many of its elements having their root in his earlier silent movies. Cast includes: Harold Lloyd, Constance Cummings, Kenneth Thompson, Spencer Charters, Mary Doran. Photography, Walter Lundin ; editing, Bernard Burton.

results.title: Mousehunt
results.creator_credit: NBCUniversal, Alan Richie, Tony Ludwig, Bruce Cohen and Gore Verbinski
results.brief_description: When their elderly father dies, two brothers inherit the family business - the Smuntz string factory - along with a dilapidated house. Ernie Smuntz (Nathan Lane) was a once revered chef but is no more thanks to an unfortunate incident involving the mayor and a cockroach; brother Lars (Lee Evans) is a devoted string factory worker. On viewing the house they discover that it was designed by a revered architect at the turn of the century and is potentially worth millions. The only obstacle to the impending fortune is one wily long time resident, a mouse that’s proving impossible to catch. Christopher Walken has a brief role as a pest exterminator. The film is rated PG due to potentially horrible traps laid by each opponent, including a freakish cat. Cast also includes Vicki Lewis, Eric Christmas and Maury Chaykin.

results.title: Mouchette
results.creator_credit: Argos Films, Parc Film, Anatole Dauman and Robert Bresson
results.brief_description: Based on the Georges Bernanos novel “Nouvelle histiore de Mouchette”, Robert Bresson’s unflinching tale of poverty and cruelty is an agonising and unsentimental film experience. Mouchette (Nadine Nortier) is a 14 year old peasant school girl. Her mother is dying and her father is a brutal alcoholic, leaving her to fend for herself and her baby brother amidst a harsh and indifferent community. When local poacher Arsene (Jean-Claude Guilbert) turns to Mouchette for an alibi over a possible murder, the young girl desperately responds to his neediness, unaware that she is being used yet again. Bresson strips scenes, performances and emotions down to their bare necessities, creating a unique style which at first might seem alienating but ultimately depicts the human experience with mystery, grace and poignancy. In French with English subtitles. Cast also includes Maria Cardinal, Paul Herbert, Jean Vimenet (Awards: Best film 1967 Venice Film festival)

results.title: Mother night
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Keith Gordon and Robert B Weide
results.brief_description: Based on a novel by Kurt Vonnegut “Mother Night” follows the story of an American playwright (Nick Nolte) living in Germany during WWII. He is approached by a US agent to become a spy. By broadcasting coded Nazi propaganda on the radio he is able to pass on allied information. During this time he seems to be a convincing Nazi. With only a few knowing his true beliefs he finds himself helpless in Israel on trial for war crimes. A moody story of assumed identity and a man alone in a strange world. Cast includes Alan Arkin, Kristen Dunst, John Goodman and an appearance of Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

results.title: Morvern Callar
results.creator_credit: Alliance Atlantis, BBC Film Unit, Charles Pattinson, George Faber, Robyn Slovo and Lynne Ramsay
results.brief_description: After the death of her boyfriend a young aimless English woman living in the West of Scotland, assumes the authorship of his unpublished novel and absconds to Spain on a spiritual journey of self-discovery. Silently grieving and struggling to come to terms with his suicide, Morvern is an ambiguous character whose extreme actions belie her gentle, unassuming air. There is something wonderfully maladroit about Samantha Morton’s performance, expertly conveying Morvern’s despair, as she reconciles the calamitous events that subsequently turn to good fortune. The depressing milieu of the Scottish scenes contrast with Morvern’s liberation in sun drenched Spain as she begins to revel in her freedom.
